channel.title: AncientBlitz
channel.description:
THIS IS NOT MY CURRENT SERVER THAT I AM HOSTING. Credits HumidityX - 90% Me - 10% fixed up a lot of stuff No more anti leeches. Hosted this for 4-5 days no problems. Don't use this anymore and felt as though it'd only be fair to release because I said I will. heres a pic so thread doesn't get deleted. [img]http://i.imgur.com/VzsKr.png[/img] Link: Client - use humidityX cache- humidityX
In a rush here, I'll check this topic tomorrow if anyone needs anything. Also, HumidityX is not as good as it seems just a heads up. :)

item.title: AncientBlitz
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

HumidityX 667/720 Official Release

I do NOT want anyone leeching my source, that is the reason I included them. I do NOT give permission to ANYONE re releasing a fixed version of my source or releasing my source anywhere but Rune-Server. I have a reputation on Rune-Server so my source must remain on Rune-Server. Hint for one of the anti leeches: “Libs” Good luck everyone

Do not try to circumvent the rules, or the author’s wishes again.

Read full topic

item.title: AncientBlitz
item.dc:creator: @kill_you704 kill you704
item.description:
@kill_you704 wrote:

The rules do not apply for that. That is just some little words Humid decided to include which really do not take stance.

1) All re-released material must be accredited appropriately! If you're going to re-release another members work, you must provide the appropriate credits on your thread. (See also rule 10) 10. I'll add this to the rules after i feel its been taken to by the members.

Well since you have all been ignoring or just not understanding it so i’ll make it clear here. Whenever you post a server or a client with the source code included you agree to the fact other people can use it. If you don’t want people “Leeching” your work then you do not release it, simple as.

Even still, most of you are using wL based servers and have no right in claiming that as your own, same with jagex’s client. You however can credit yourself for whatever code you have added and if the code you have added is someone elses then you credit them either in the topic and in comments in the source code.

Read full topic

item.title: AncientBlitz
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

That’s not my point. I have no doubt that you removed and fixed the anti-leeches. Good job, however:

HumidityX 667/720 Official Release

I do NOT give permission to ANYONE re releasing a fixed version of my source or releasing my source anywhere but Rune-Server.

Read full topic

item.title: AncientBlitz
item.dc:creator: @kill_you704 kill you704
item.description:
@kill_you704 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:7, topic:468197”][quote author=kill you704]
There was over 10 anti-leeches
[/quote]

[quote author=Humid link=topic=554295.msg4059692#msg4059692 date=1343325743]
In this source there are 5 Anti leeches.

I do NOT give permission to ANYONE re releasing a fixed version of my source or releasing my source anywhere but Rune-Server.
[/quote][/quote]
I will list the anti-leeches I remember, definitely more than 5.

  1. db-cd in run.cmd. db-cd is not a command -cd is so theres 1.
  2. 4 JAR files were missing in the lib folder.
  3. Missing bracket in buttonhandler Class.
  4. Missing method and bracket in commands Class.
  5. Missing method and initializer in Launcher Class, which I had to re-write.
  6. When you die you do not teleport to respawn area.
  7. NPC’s have no emotes.
    There were more I just can’t remember.

Read full topic

item.title: AncientBlitz
item.dc:creator: @kill_you704 kill you704
item.description:
@kill_you704 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:4, topic:468197”][quote author=kill you704 link=topic=585159.msg4158766#msg4158766 date=1352864879]
No, look at humidityX post… HumidityX had anti leeches people were complaining about so I decided I would be nice and fix it up for them and add a little more cool features. All it is, is HumidityX.
[/quote]

Add a Developmental Log. From viewing this Topic, we don’t know what you corrected. This will let people know exactly what was edited and when.

EDIT: I don’t think fixing anti-leeches for a Public release is allowed. I’m not sure.[/quote]
There was over 10 anti-leeches half included me re-writing methods(that were not in the base). So technically I added my own work.

Read full topic
